availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Elizabeth Mosby Coffey. Father of Susan E. Coffey, Martha J. Coffey, Josephine Coffey, Sarah M. Coffey, and Hugh A. Coffey. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville District, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 8, p. 15.
Find A Grave, "Hugh Gilbreath Coffey (1812-1886)," Memorial #66449988, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66449988 (accessed June 11, 2018).
